      <h2>1. Introduction to the Chevening Scholarship</h2>
      <p>Chevening Scholarships enable promising young leaders from around the world to pursue a one-year master's degree at leading universities in the UK. If you have passion, influence, and a desire to solve local or global challenges, Chevening is the opportunity for you.</p>

      <div class="highlight-box">
        <ul>
          <li>Professional and academic development.</li>
          <li>Expand your international network.</li>
          <li>Experience British culture.</li>
          <li>Build a long-lasting cooperative relationship with the UK.</li>
        </ul>
      </div>

      <h2>2. Who can apply for the Chevening Scholarship?</h2>
      <p>Chevening does not have any restrictions on age, gender, religion, marital status, or profession. What matters is your leadership mindset, clear goals, and potential to make a positive impact.</p>

      <h3>‚úÖ Eligibility requirements:</h3>
      <div class="highlight-box">
        <ul>
          <li>Be a citizen of an eligible country.</li>
          <li>Commit to returning to your home country for at least 2 years after the scholarship ends.</li>
          <li>Have at least 2,800 hours of work experience.</li>
          <li>Have a bachelor's degree that qualifies you for a master's degree in the UK.</li>
          <li>Apply for 3 different courses and have at least 1 unconditional offer of admission.</li>
        </ul>
      </div>

      <h3>‚ùå Not eligible if:</h3>
      <div class="highlight-box">
        <ul>
          <li>Have British or dual British citizenship.</li>
          <li>Have previously studied in the UK with another UK government scholarship.</li>
          <li>Are an employee or relative of a UK government agency in the last 2 years.</li>
        </ul>
      </div>

      <h2>3. Work experience</h2>
      <p>Applicants need at least 2,800 hours of work experience (equivalent to 2 years full-time), which can be calculated from:</p>
      <div class="highlight-box">
        <ul>
          <li>Full-time or part-time employment.</li>
          <li>Volunteer activities.</li>
          <li>Paid or unpaid internships.</li>
        </ul>
      </div>

      <h2>4. Chevening Application Guide</h2>
      <div class="highlight-box">
        <ol>
          <li>Check your eligibility.</li>
          <li>Choose 3 master's courses in the UK.</li>
          <li>Prepare your application and letters of recommendation.</li>
          <li>Apply online through the Chevening system.</li>
          <li>Attend an interview and submit an unconditional offer of admission.</li>
        </ol>
      </div>

      <h2>5. Preparing for the Chevening interview</h2>
      <p>Prepare thoroughly: master the content of your application, your career orientation, and demonstrate your leadership ability and confident English communication skills.</p>

      <h2>6. Choosing a course in the UK</h2>
      <p>Applicants need to choose 3 eligible master's programs from universities in the UK.<br>
      <a href="https://www.chevening.org/scholarships/find-a-course/" target="_blank">Find a suitable course (Chevening Course Finder)</a></p>

      <h2>7. Improving English skills</h2>
      <p>Although Chevening does not require an English language certificate when applying, most UK universities do. Hone your skills to write better essays and perform better in interviews.</p>
